reviews.text: A cheap, no frills, no tipping spot that serves huge portion of noodles.  Wished the soup it was served hotter (temp wise) and the meat seasoned better.

I had the beef stew hand pulled noodle, they give you lots of noodles but I don't like the texture of the noodle(slightly hard) and the also don't like the broth, the scallion pancake I got is weird too, weirdly too chewy(ordered half but my jaw is tired), rather have the ones in he supermarket. Service is good, food isn't to my taste, though it is good value if you like the food
I have been going here since they opened. They have the BEST Vegetable Steam Dumplings ever and their hand drawn noodle soup with beef chunks and tendon scrumptious! Highly recommend going here!
Delicious and inexpensive, like back in Asia.

Waited an entire hour just for them to say they missed my order. I asked midway through on whether they were done or not and they said it was coming soon and didnâ€™t double check. Decided to be generous and give them extra time since theyâ€¦

One of several very good Lanzhou lamian places in Queens, you get the sense at this one more than any other that it is a big part of everyday life for a huge number of expats, students, and workersâ€”basically anyone who knows what Lanzhou noodles are and can appreciate when a day's worth of carbohydrates costs less than Happy Meal. The dining room is frequently packed but the only noise you'll hear is a chorus of slurps.

The dumplings they serve now is not good compared to the dumplings they used to sell when they opened the store. The taste and texture has gone downhill. It's a shame. But their noodles are still good.

They need to do a better job of cleaning the tables and floors. It's disgusting and one time i came in and it smelled so bad. I'm not sure if it's the garbage or they used old dirty mops to clean but it ruined my appetite. I dont frequent this place anymore cause of the food quality and the lack of cleanliness.
Nice authentic vibe. Dumplings were good, but thick and doughy. Only pork dumplings offered.
Taste like northern Chinese food for real, I hope they're open 7 days a week.
great deal, big portion.
If you like hand pulled noodles, this is the place. Self-service. No tipping but cash only.
Itâ€™s a gemâ€¦.. fast service and quality food wat else we look forâ€¦ Iâ€™ve coming here for 5 years now..
Very mid
Great food and prices

Found this place off of an internet recommendation and it didnâ€™t disappoint. The scallion pancakes and dumplings were delicious, particularly the dumplings dipped in a savory soy sauce they had. The food is both oily & down-to-earth.
Freshly made noodles are excellent. Great place for a quick meal.
Perfect place for a quick bite and come here every week for the noodles.
Good price, good quantity, average quality!

uff tremenda comida que nos dimos precio servicio y comida muy bien de verdad 5 sopas 4 Ã³rdenes de domplig y pagamos barato y estuvo muy rico recomiendo la sopa nÃºmero 6 todo excelente mente bien los recomiendo y regresarÃ© verdad
I love the noodles a lot, nice & spicy. Very good value for the amount of food.
Love the Beef Spicy Soup. Big portion.

Come here for the hand pulled noodles! Juicy, flavorful, tender pork, chewy delicious noodles, all for under 10$! And of course I drink all of the soup. Bring cash! Watch them make the noodles in person!
The best noodle soup in NYC. We come from Manhattan just to eat the noodles from here

Dumplings tasted too doughy and the meat didnâ€™t have that much flavor. Best part was the dipping sauce. Once again I think I donâ€™t prefer chinese dumplings I rather the thin wrapper gyoza styleâ€¦I want to like it more
We order fried dumpling and boiled my husband love it , it taste good
Amazing hand pulled noodle soup. If you come by at lunch time, you'll likely hear 10 different languages being spoken. You're basically getting a bowl of noodles and a duolingo subscription.
Just got fish soup with a fly in it. The prices are good though for a soup with a fly!! Great that they have given my money back!!
Freshly made noodles in a delicious beef broth or any other noodle dish.   Super tasty dumplings.  And the price awesomely reasonable.
Food is good. You get a good sized portions for what you pay.
Loved the beef noodle soup. The broth is excellent and the meat is so tender.
Itâ€™s really good. Nice employee. My Soup was more salty than flavorful though. My gf soup was good

My first time experience about hot and spicy soup was so good, so I came back to get another one.   And got totally different horrible result .  Ordered beef stew mild, very very little spicy, but came very spicy and tendons!!! No beef!â€¦
The spicy noodles soup is pretty oily. The good things is choices of meat with reasonable price. Also there are good amounts of meat in the bowl
If you if you like noodles,if you like dumpling amazing I visit this place for years

Really great soup and noodles some of the best in the city. The hand pulled noodles has delicious broth and generous portion. The malatang is also good but really spicy so I recommend the little spicy.

My favorite dine out place since childhood. I ate their famous hand pulled noodles for 9 years and still keep going. Though I visited less nowadays since I moved to Brooklyn but every time when I come to Elmhurst this is my go-to spot. And I love that sweet beautiful sister taking orders at the counter. She is the nicest person Iâ€™d ever met in my life. Wish this place great success for years to come!
Neighborhood staple
Inexpensive little hole I. The wall with great dumplings and soup
Dumplings are great and affordable! Definitely a great spot for quality dumplings

This spot is basically a staple name brand to Elmhurst. Been coming here to this place for over a decade (this place used to be in the back alleyway in the early 2010s). The dumplings has gone down in quality just a bit but hey for that price you cannot beat it.

Oh and if youâ€™re craving dumplings late night call them to make sure they have them available because they have their last batch for the night
Best hand pulled noodles in town.

The pork dumplings are a steal here! Even with the price increase that happened somewhere between April 2024 and July 2024, you get 4 massive dumplings (that look like momo) for only $3 (from $2.75). Keep in mind they only accept cash from what I remember.
Loveeeee this place cheap and delicious soup .
Very good Chinese food

Best deal and food around.
Definitely stop in.

âš ï¸â›”ï¸Avoid This Place at All Costs!â€¼ï¸â˜¢ï¸
I ordered pork dumplings from Lao Bei Fang Dumpling House, and it was a complete nightmare. Within hours of eating, I was violently ill! throwing up nonstop, severe diarrhea, and my stomach hurt so bad I could barely function. I also developed a rash on my face, chills, and facial swelling. This wasnâ€™t just food poisoning it was terrifying.

I wouldnâ€™t wish this on anyone. Based on my experience and the other bad reviews, itâ€™s clear they have serious issues with food safety and hygiene. If you care about your health, stay far away from this place.â€¼ï¸â€¼ï¸â€¼ï¸â€¼ï¸â€¼ï¸âš ï¸
The best noodle soup in the world. Taste excellent.  Portion excellent.  Service excellent.
Great food at the best price. Every food on the menu is worth the bang for your buck. If you're  on a budget and want to fill your stomach with Great affordable food, this is it.

Lao Bei Fang Dumpling House in Elmhurst, Queens, is a delightful culinary gem that excels in authentic Chinese comfort food. Their pan-fried dumplings are a standout, perfectly crisp on the outside while delivering a juicy, flavorful filling. Each bite is a satisfying blend of textures that leaves you craving more.

The hand-pulled noodle soup is equally impressive, featuring tender noodles swimming in a rich, savory broth that warms the soul. The freshness of the noodles, combined with fresh vegetables and a hint of spice, makes it a comforting choice, especially on a chilly day.

The atmosphere is casual and welcoming, ideal for a quick meal or a relaxed dining experience. With generous portions and reasonable prices, Lao Bei Fang Dumpling House is a must-visit for anyone craving delicious dumplings and noodles in Elmhurst. Highly recommended!

Such an amazing value and great flavors! My favorite noodle soup!!!
House Noodle soup- $11.75, comes with the bone! Lots of tripe too. My favorite!
Beef SautÃ©ed Noodles- $13.75 great ratio of veggies, beef, and noodles.
Pork and Leek Pan Fried Dumplings- $6.00 for 8 pieces, so good and they are pretty BIG sized.

You also get a lot of sauce options like the vinegar, soy sauce, hot sauce, chili sauce, and a few others Iâ€™m not familiar with.

Came here almost two years later and itâ€™s just as good. The noodle soup portions have gotten bigger! Fresh hand-pulled noodles with seemingly endless toppings. I could come here everyday!

â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”-
I am in LOVE. This place is such a gem. If you want good, hearty Chinese food, this is the place to go. Not only was the food PHENOMENAL, the prices were unbeatable. The portions are more than generous. My soup was so packed with different toppings that it took me a minute to find the actual noodles. The dumplings were so fresh! You could see the chef hand-making the dumplings. I seriously canâ€™t wait to come back here.

9/27/2024: (Update #2)
My favorite spot to get boiled dumplings in Elmhurst! Iâ€™m a bit biased - I grew up in this neighborhood, so Lao Bei Fang is very nostalgic to me. When you see the bright red awning, you know youâ€™re at the right spot. The pork and leek boiled dumplings here are very hearty, meaty, and super juicy. Theyâ€™re thicker-skinned dumplings which are definitely going to leave you full. Came here last week with my husband for a fast, casual experience with cafeteria-style seating and good dumplings. A box will fill you up quick in this no-frills restaurant. Donâ€™t forget to load up on the chili oil, soy sauce, and hot sauce!

2024 pricing-
ğŸ¥Ÿ $3 for (4) pork & leek fried dumplings
ğŸ¥Ÿ $6 for (8) pork & leek boiled dumplings

4/29/2021: (Update #1)
Still cash only & we noticed that the prices for the dumplings haven't increased for a couple of years now! My fiance and I ordered the #1 Pork & Leek Fried Dumpling (8 pieces, $4.25), #2 Pork & Leek Boiled Dumplings (8 pieces, $4.25), and #44 Scallion Pancakes w/ Beef ($4.50). Had a pretty mediocre meal at Lao Bei Fang Dumpling House last night though. The fried dumplings were much too charred and dry, compared to the previous times we've had meals here. The scallion pancake was not appetizing at all, being too thick and flavorless. The limp lettuce and the 2 thin beef circles didn't go well together either. At least the Pork & Leek Boiled Dumplings were still good - next time we'll just stick with multiples of that dish!

6/10/2019: (Original Review)
Lao Bei Fang Dumpling House is always a good comfort food stop, if you're in the mood for some delicious greasy foods. My boyfriend and I came here after a day of rock climbing and it really hit the spot. We ordered the #1 Pork & Leek Fried Dumpling (8 pieces, $4.25), #2 Pork & Leek Boiled Dumplings (8 pieces, $4.25), and #28 All-in-one House Special Hand-Pulled Noodle Soup ($8.75). Filling, good portions, and reasonably priced. Street parking could be a bit tricky, but is available (metered and free). Cash only, and they call your number when your order is ready!

Best option for cheap eats in the neighborhood. Dumplings is our favorite here. The place can get a little messy sometimes but itâ€™s not a big issue for us, we came here for their food.

-Dumplings (5/5) affordable, tasty and fresh most of the time.
-House special noodle soup (4.5/5) They kinda lessen the portion of the meat but the taste and texture are consistent for the noodles and broth.

Been here 3x and I'm satisfied everytime a visit. Dumplings are so good and the Hand Pulled Noodles is treat! So far I had, Mixed, Pork and Beef all are bang for the bucket.

****edited July 29, 2024****

Since this place was my go to spot when I missed our local soup back home, I pay homage by doing a content on my tiktok page @chiefhaskycreates

Just check it out cause links are prohibited.

Looks can be deceiving. Both exterior and interior is nothing to brag about, simply look like many other take out joint with some tables scattered but the amount of foot traffic is insane and many for their famous Pork & Leek Potstickers. They do serve noodles and such but the main event are the Potstickers

These potstickers are made in huge batches and since so many people buy (sold in increments of 4), they are always fresh, hot, juicy with perfect golden crispy crust. Donâ€™t forget the hot oil and dumpling sauce.

This is definitely a must try if youâ€™re in Elmhurst area. Street parking after 7pm is easier and free. Thereâ€™s no tipping and itâ€™s self service. Cheapest and best bang for your buck in the area.

Lao Bei is such a nice spot to get a quick lunch or dinner! The prices are low and the amount of food you get is insane. If you are a dumpling fan, their dumplings are different than gyoza that other places have; it has a much thicker skin and definitely feels heartier. The noodles are hand-pulled and have the perfect texture, and they do not skimp on the toppings. There is chili oil on every table that you can feel free to add on, I think it adds a very nice flavor to it. They also sell packs of 50 frozen dumplings, I try to make sure I always have them in stock when I come. The only thing is that the boiled dumplings do take a bit of time to come out, which is probably because they cooked to order; not a complaint but just an FYI in case you are limited on time.
Delicious beef noodle soup and Dumplings at a price you just cannot beat. Don't be scared by the lowkey tables, this place is a treat. Noodles definitely taste hand made and the soup hits.

This is a hole in the wall. Come here for great food, not 5 star dining atmosphere. Cafeteria-style seating. Very authentic food. If you tell them spicy, be prepared for real spicy (which to me is amazing). As someone who loves and always gets spicy food, even I was tearing up at the end. No tipping! The dumplings took a while to come out which means it is fresh. The chef was hand-pulling noodles the whole time. I am so glad I stumbled on this place for cheap, authentic, delicious Chinese and only wish I lived closer!

This is the spot if u want something quick and cheap. We got the pork and leek boiled dumplings. They raised their prices by a dollar is it was $4.25 for 8 pieces. Still bomb tho. I recommend calling in early for dumplings bc they take a long time to make. Noodles are much quicker

I had eaten here 2-3 times before but I could not form an opinion till today.  It's definitely cheap.  For as low as $6.50, one gets a big bowl of freshly hand-pulled noodle, stir fried or in broth.  And they really do give ample amount of noodle!  The menu selections are fun and enticing.  The value proposition is definitely there,  and I can see why the locals keep coming back and where the rave reviews come from.

But that's all the good things I can say about this place.  The divey setup at the ordering counter, and the self-help communal tables remind me of the street hawker setup at night markets in Asia -- not so hygienic.  One would be tempted to sit down because of the lure of the food, but at the same time wary of the risk of getting sick as a result of downplaying the possible lack of hygiene.  Well, I had been lucky before but finally met my fate today.  I had the Lamb Mixed Hand Drawn Noodle Soup and a couple of pot stickers for lunch.  One of the two dishes caused my stomach cramps so bad that I had to make 2 emergency stops during my 3 hour drive back to PA.

Eat at your own risk!  For me, getting sick once is more than enough.

The place is cafeteria style with only 4-5 items of side dishes display then the rest of it you can order from the menu. They do make the fresh hand pulled noodle here which pretty nice. The noodle is good with huge serving amount as you can see from my photo and that when I already ate half of it! The Dumpling is ok.

The fried pork dumplings were good, nothing special. However the soup was truly disappointing. I have tried various restaurants but this soup wasn't made correctly. It felt like pure oil, with an addition of vegetables and salty leathery meat.

Had the handpulled beef stew noodle soup. The bouillon was so so but the meat ant noodle was great.
I previously had the hot and spicy noodle soup which is much better but I likeâ€¦

Great prices. Great taste. For More than 20 years. Fresh hand made preparation of food. Nice atmosphere. Gently personnel.
You gonna love it.
Pretty good place for dumpling and noodle, especially noodle soup, besides the fact that everything is a little too oily. The place is not that spacious. They take cash only.

Cool place. Great food. Authentic tasting soups and noodles and dumplings.
The prices include taxes, and what you see is what you pay!! The way it should be !!

Not the best food but very affordable. I do not reccomend ordering spicy ramen because when I did, it tasted like they just dumped 1/4 cup chili oil in it. Very oily and lacked flavor. I do reccomend trying their scallion pancakes and pork buns! Personally, I didn't like how the beef contains a lot of muscle but to each their own.

Recommend the Beef Noodle Soup for $6.99. The broth is meaty, boc choy is soft yet still crunchy. They add a good amount of tender meat for the amount of noodle, which are made in-house. Wish theyâ€™d add more fresh veggies into their soup,â€¦

Yummy noodle and soup! We got dumplings too! Cafeteria style ğŸ˜

Ordered the beef tendon soup noodles. You can totally taste the difference with the noodles. We also ordered the chicken stir fry and even though the noodles were fresh the rest of the material wasnâ€™t.

Their beef spicy soup (Malatang) is my favorite for all years. It comes with lots of ingredients: broccoli, tofu, seaweed, bok Choy, zucchini, rice cake, vermicelli, cabbage, fried tofu, tofu skin, etc. I ordered for â€œvery spicyâ€ so it turned out to be a little greasy and hot. Itâ€™s all served in a big bowl for reasonable price. The restaurant is self served, no tip required, very good for solo eaters or people who want quick bites.
Lots of food for the price, the dumplings were juicy and not dry. The only option for dumplings given was pork. The noodles were chewy and fresh. The only thing is that they use msg. But good!

This going to be one of my favorite places to dumpling go to go places, I went with my cousin and his girlfriend because she was craving dumpling.  The place is pretty big so is easy to find a table over here.

I will say if you're in the quest for a Fried Dumplings or a  Boiled Dumplings, maybe Steam Dumplings or maybe another type of dumplings you find your spot.  structure of the dumplings and the taste are phenomenal and the price for it makes it even better. The staff are ok only bad things about this place is a cash only place. You also can find all time or ramen and noodle soup over here, although the place is called dumplings house you can also all kinds of Asian dishes.

Parking for those that does have car is a bit hard.
It is absolutely recommended, especially if you're looking for cheap eats and value for money. The free chili garlic on every table is a plus points.
